title: 114_hr108
content: AMENDMENTS RELATING TO THE CIVIL SERVICE RETIREMENT SYSTEM. Section 8335a of Title 5, United States Code, states that Members of Congress will no longer be subject to retirement coverage under this subchapter, and no further Government contributions or deductions will be made for them. This does not affect any rights or benefits accrued prior to this change and does not impact their eligibility to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan. Nothing in subsection (a) affects a Member's eligibility to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan. Regulations for this section may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in Title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress. Amendments related to the Federal Employees' Retirement System. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress. A new section is added to the United States Code stating that Members of Congress will no longer be subject to retirement coverage after a certain period or completion of 5 years of service. No further Government contributions or deductions will be made once a Member ceases to be subject to this chapter. Members of Congress who first join after a certain date will not be subject to retirement coverage, and no Government contributions or deductions will be made for them. This does not affect any prior rights, entitlements, or benefits under this chapter. Participation in the Thrift Savings Plan is not affected. Regulations for this section may be prescribed by the Director of the Office. Regulations for retirement coverage may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management, except for matters related to the Thrift Savings Plan, which are prescribed by the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections of chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress.
